intro: Psychotria sagittalis, commonly known as the arrowleaf psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its distinctive arrow-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in humid forests. Psychotria sagittalis is also noted for its role in traditional medicine and as a food source for certain wildlife.
